name: wirte

procedures: T1036.005::[WIRTE] has named a first stage dropper `Kaspersky Update Agent` in order to appear legitimate.
T1059.001::[WIRTE] has used PowerShell for script execution.
T1059.005::[WIRTE] has used VBScript  in its operations.
T1071.001::[WIRTE] has used HTTP for network communication.
T1105::[WIRTE] has downloaded PowerShell code from the C2 server to be executed.
T1140::[WIRTE] has used Base64 to decode malicious VBS script.
T1204.002::[WIRTE] has attempted to lure users into opening malicious MS Word and Excel files to execute malicious payloads.
T1218.010::[WIRTE] has used `regsvr32.exe` to trigger the execution of a malicious script.
T1566.001::[WIRTE] has sent emails to intended victims with malicious MS Word and Excel attachments.
T1571::[WIRTE] has used HTTPS over ports 2083 and 2087 for C2.
T1588.002::[WIRTE] has obtained and used [Empire] for post-exploitation activities.

description: [WIRTE](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0090) is a threat group that has been active since at least August 2018. [WIRTE](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0090) has targeted government, diplomatic, financial, military, legal, and technology organizations in the Middle East and Europe.(Citation: Lab52 WIRTE Apr 2019)(Citation: Kaspersky WIRTE November 2021)
